field.name: description
field.value: The current version of JQueryValidator adds error messages and rules to the html form element attributes (class=rules, title=messages). The problem is that if we add 2 or 3 validation attributes to the model eg. [ValidateNonEmpty, ValidateLength(5)] than the messages are concatenated together and because of that they are not displayed one by one. A good example on how it works with displaying separate messages can be found at http://jquery.bassistance.de/validate/demo/index.html. In this page the first 2 fields(Name and Email) of the first form display 2 distinct error messages, based on the input.

comment.text: In the JQueryValidation patch I have changes the JQueryValidation class to create the validation rules and messages on the actual javascript validator constructor. This way the messages are displayed in sync with the validation rule.
